t: Proverbs 21
The*p king's heart is in the hand of the Lord,*s as the rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.
Every*p way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the Lord*s pondereth the hearts.
To*p do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the Lord*s than sacrifice.
An*p high look, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.
The*p thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.
The*p getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.
The*p robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.
The*p way of man is froward and strange: but as for the pure, his work is right.
It*p is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
The*p soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.
When*p the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
The*p righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked: but God overthroweth the wicked for their wickedness.
Whoso*p stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.
A*p gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.
It*p is joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
The*p man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.
He*p that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
The*p wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.
It*p is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.
There*p is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.
He*p that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.
A*p wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.
Whoso*p keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
Proud*p and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.
The*p desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.
He*p coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
The*p sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?
A*p false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.
A*p wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for the upright, he directeth his way.
There*p is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the Lord.*s
The*p horse is prepared against the day of battle: but safety is of the Lord.*s
